intro: Ruellia discifolia, commonly known as the small-flowered ruellia, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas. It is a member of the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its opposite, ovate leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows as an herb or shrub, reaching heights of up to 1 meter. Its flowers are usually blue or purple, with five lobes, and are clustered in terminal inflorescences. Ruellia discifolia is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
